src:
Na novomeški konferenci Logistika v kmetijstvu tudi o sodelovanju s Sibirijo
07 Nov 2019, 07:20 by STA, M. Ž.
Novo mesto - Na 13. mednarodni konferenci Logistika v kmetijstvu, ki je v Novem mestu včeraj potekala v organizaciji Grma Novo mesto - centra biotehnike in turizma, gostili tudi delegacijo iz Rusije oz. predstavnike sibirskih regij Krasnojarsk in Hakasija. S temi so se pogovarjali o medinstitucionalnem sodelovanju v kmetijstvu, živilstvu in turizmu.
Direktor novomeškega centra Tone Hrovat je za STA povedal, da pri sodelovanju z Državno agrarno univerzo Krasnojarsk, s katero so zadnje desetletje sodelovali predvsem pri razvoju znanosti, šolstva in izmenjavi študentov, stopajo na novo raven.
Pri tem bi radi zgradili "most gospodarskega sodelovanja", močna delegacija, ki se je udeležila konference, pa je po njegovem močan porok, da se bo to tudi zgodilo.
Krasnojarsk, ki je eno najhitreje razvijajočih se mest Rusije, bo tako postalo dom marsikateremu slovenskemu podjetju, iz Sibirije pa bo lahko v Slovenijo prišlo veliko ekološko pridelanih živil. V obratni smeri bo lahko v Krasnojarsk prispelo tudi slovensko vino, je po poročanju STA še napovedal Hrovat.
Po podatkih prirediteljev so sicer za delegacijo iz Rusije in predstavnike drugih držav pripravili bogat program, katerega osrednji cilj je spoznavanje gospodarskega potenciala Slovenije na področju kmetijstva, živilstva in turizma.
Gre za nekakšen "most izobraževanja, znanosti in gospodarstva" kot nadgradnje več let trajajočega sodelovanja izobraževalnih ustanov Grm Novo mesto - center biotehnike in turizma z Državno agrarno univerzo Krasnojarsk in drugimi strokovnimi ter znanstvenimi ustanovami mednarodnega prostora.
Namen omenjenega obiska in pogovorov je okrepitev sodelovanja med izobraževalnimi in znanstvenimi ustanovami, vzpostavitev aktivnega prenosa znanja in izkušenj na področju organizacije slovenskega zadružništva na območje sibirskih regij ter vzpostavitev okolja za neposredne poslovne tokove pri blagovni izmenjavi kmetijskih pridelkov, živilskih izdelkov in turistične ponudbe.
V popoldanskem delu so konferenco, ki so jo sicer namenili razpravi o "vlogi in pomenu človeških virov pri logistiki v kmetijstvu", nadaljevali s tremi ločenimi razpravami. Pripravili so tudi kratke predstavitve ruskih in slovenskih podjetnikov in za javnost zaprto strateško razpravo o medinstitucionalnem in gospodarskem sodelovanju regij Sibirija ter jugovzhodna Slovenija na področju kmetijstva, živilstva in turizma.
Prireditelji konference so bili Grm Novo mesto - center biotehnike in turizma, Visoka šola za upravljanje podeželja Grm Novo mesto, Zadružna zveza Slovenije, Fakulteta za logistiko Univerze v Mariboru in Občina Sevnica.
Delegacija iz Rusije se bo na enotedenskem obisku v Sloveniji mudila do ponedeljka.
text:
At the Logistics in Agriculture conference in Novi Sad, he also discussed cooperation with Siberia
07 Nov 2019, 07:20 by STA, M. Ž.
Novo mesto - The 13th international conference Logistics in Agriculture, held yesterday in Novo mesto, organized by Grma Novo mesto - a center for biotechnology and tourism - also hosted a delegation from Russia or. representatives of the Siberian regions of Krasnoyarsk and Khakassia. They talked about interinstitutional cooperation in agriculture, food and tourism.
The director of the Novi Sad Center, Tone Hrovat, told the STA that they are taking a new level in cooperation with the Krasnoyarsk State Agrarian University, which they have been involved with for the last decade primarily in science development, education and student exchange.
We would like to build a "bridge of economic co-operation" and a strong delegation attending the conference, he said, is a strong guarantee that this will happen.
Krasnoyarsk, which is one of the fastest developing cities in Russia, will thus become home to many Slovenian companies, and many organic food products will be able to come to Slovenia from Siberia. In the opposite direction, Slovenian wine may also arrive in Krasnoyarsk, Hrovat announced, according to STA.
According to the organizers, a rich program was prepared for the delegation from Russia and representatives of other countries, whose main objective is to realize the economic potential of Slovenia in the field of agriculture, food and tourism.
It is a kind of "bridge of education, science and economy" as an upgrade of several years of continuous cooperation between educational institutions Grm Novo mesto - a center of biotechnics and tourism with the State Agrarian University of Krasnoyarsk and other professional and scientific institutions of the international space.
The purpose of the visit and talks is to strengthen cooperation between educational and scientific institutions, to establish an active transfer of knowledge and experience in the organization of Slovenian cooperatives to the Siberian regions and to create an environment for direct business flows in the exchange of agricultural products, food products and tourist offer.
In the afternoon, the conference, which was otherwise intended to discuss the "role and importance of human resources in logistics in agriculture", continued with three separate discussions. They also prepared short presentations of Russian and Slovenian entrepreneurs and closed a strategic debate on the inter-institutional and economic cooperation between the regions of Siberia and southeastern Slovenia in the fields of agriculture, food and tourism.
The organizers of the conference were Grm Novo mesto - Center for Biotechnics and Tourism, College of Rural Management Grm Novo mesto, Cooperative Union of Slovenia, Faculty of Logistics, University of Maribor and Municipality of Sevnica.
The delegation from Russia will make a one-day visit to Slovenia by Monday.
